meanings.definition: Make (someone or something) late or slow.
meanings.sent1: The heavy traffic delayed the bus from arriving on time.
meanings.sent2: The train was delayed due to mechanical issues.
meanings.sent3: The snail delayed its journey to enjoy the scenery along the way.
meanings.sent4: Her procrastination delayed her success like a stubborn obstacle in her path.
meanings.sent5: The storm delayed the flight, leaving passengers stranded at the airport.

meanings.sent1: They decided to delay the meeting until next week.
meanings.sent2: The event was delayed because of bad weather.
meanings.sent3: The student delayed studying for the exam until the last minute.
meanings.sent4: The decision to delay the project had long-term consequences.
meanings.sent5: The company had to delay the product launch due to production issues.
